subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing philosophy
msgSnippet: ... I have a simple observation to make on this topic. I have seen unit testing work on many kinds of problems. I have never seen theorem provers work on
messageBody:
obi300 wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> a colleague of mine once told me that she never did unit testing. Her
> argument was that unit tests, as performed today, are able to check
> only a specific path on the code, the path stablished by initial
> conditions. Instead, she performed specificacion checking using
> theorem provers and other advanced tools. This has made me think
> about the utility of unit testing and the level of code reliability
> that unit testing can provide.
>
> What do you have to say about this? Could it have an impact on unit
> testing and, specifically, on JUnit?

I have a simple observation to make on this topic.

I have seen unit testing work on many kinds of problems. I have never
seen theorem provers work on anything except trivial problems on which I
don't need theorem provers.
